name: A Marginal Victory
description: Airiam's husband, Stephen, might be the only one who can convince her to end her crusade. Join Picard and Soji to reunite them, then find a way to win the day for synthetics--even if it must happen in the margins.
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Hugh, Rios, Burnham, Cyberneticists, Soji or crew with matching Battle Traits will provide a bonus.
-- Using the Valdore, La Sirena, or Jem'Hadar Battleship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Hugh, Rios, Burnham, Cyberneticists, or Soji

rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

ship.name: The Valdore
ship.flavor: A Valdore-type Romulan Warbird, The Valdore battled alongside the USS Enterprise against the Reman warbird the Scimitar at the battle in the Bassen Rift.

ship.name: La Sirena
ship.flavor: A Kaplan F17 Speed Freighter for hire, captained by Rios. Supplemented with a variety of Holoprograms to assist across a variety of dangerous emergency situations.

Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%

next_threshold_rewards.name: Credits
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

screens.text: "Airiam became a synthetic after a shuttle accident. Her husband Stephen died in the same accident. Thanks to the same temporal anomaly that's brought me here--where, strangely, things aren't that different--has brought him back."
"Stephen isn't--or wasn't--equally horrified by synthetics, I hope? If we reunite them, maybe he can talk Airiam down?"

"It's a little more complicated than that. The Romulans want the synthetic ban to pass--so they've captured Stephen and spun the truth of the accident that killed him to make it look like synthetics were to blame."

"We will rescue Stephen. Even if he thinks similarly, a reunion may well prove more important to Airiam than this misguided crusade. Captain, if you and Rios can distract the Romulans, I believe we can pull this off with a minimal amount of fuss."
"We extracted Stephen and forced a reunion with Airiam. The human Airiam, that is... but now he's with my Airiam."

"She's been so devoted to this cause that even getting Stephen back wasn't enough to bring her down. I wish I could disown her, but... it sounds like me. Or like a person who will one day let themselves be shot out an airlock."

responses.text: "I would remind you that's a good thing, Commander."
"Ask Raffi. She started all this with her needless meddling."

screens.text: "Great. So what do we do now? In our time, exposing the Romulan connection to the attack on Mars was enough to unravel the movement, but we don't have any inciting incident like that here."
"Maybe we shouldn't stop the ban at all. Maybe this is the way things are meant to happen. If you believe in that sort of thing."
"Inventive, but I hardly think we have the resources to fake the deaths of millions--let alone the stomachs."

"If Raffi could unintentionally jumpstart an entire anti-synthetic movement via Discovery's service logs, I know she can find a way to end one without blowing up Mars. You'll just need to keep the Romulans busy until she does..."
